info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 08 at 3:52PM MDT until August 08 at 6:45PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING FOR THE SPRING BURN SCAR REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR NORTHEASTERN COSTILLA AND SOUTHWESTERN HUERFANO COUNTIES... At 352 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain over the Spring Burn Scar. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 0.5 to 1.5 inches in 1 hour with the heaviest falling across the southern portions of the burn scar. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Excessive rainfall over the burn scar may result in debris flow moving through the Middle Creek, Vega Creek, Wagon Creek, Indian Creek and Rilling Creek. The debris flow can consist of rock, mud, vegetation and other loose materials. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding in and around the Spring Burn Scar. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of areas in and around the Spring Burn Scar. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Spring Burn Scar south of Highway 160 in Costilla county, Spring Burn Scar south of Highway 160 in Huerfano county, Indian Creek on the southeastern Spring Burn Scar, Spring Burn Scar north of Highway 160, La Veta Pass and Cuchara. This includes the following high risk locations... Sulphur Springs on Indian Creek, County Road 421 near Indian Creek, South Abeyta Creek near County Road 443, South Abeyta Creek near County Road 442, South Abeyta Creek near County Road 441 and Pass Creek Road. Although rainfall has diminished across northern portions of the Spring Burn Scar, additional thunderstorm activity may develop and move into the area. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...0.5-1.5 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: This is a life threatening situation. Heavy rainfall may cause extensive and severe flash flooding of creeks...streams...and ditches in the Spring Burn Scar. Severe debris flows can also be anticipated across roads. Roads and driveways may be washed away in places. If you encounter flood waters...climb to safety. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
